channel.title: Graphics Problem
channel.description:
All objects that are not part of the world have non-textured squares around them:
[url]https://sphotos-b.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash3/s720x720/581434_3900541346248_1221244119_n.jpg[/url]
------------------ System Information ------------------ Time of this report: 10/3/2012, 13:46:53 Machine name: KIDS-PC Operating System: Windows 7 Ultimate 64-bit (6.1, Build 7601) Service Pack 1 (7601.win7sp1_rtm.101119-1850) Language: English (Regional Setting: English) System Manufacturer: Acer System Model: ASE380/AST180/APM8 BIOS: )Phoenix - Award WorkstationBIOS v6.00PG Processor: AMD Athlon(tm) 64 X2 Dual Core Processor 6000+ (2 CPUs), ~3.1GHz Memory: 8192MB RAM Available OS Memory: 8192MB RAM Page File: 2384MB used, 13997MB available Windows Dir: C:\Windows DirectX Version: DirectX 11 DX Setup Parameters: Not found User DPI Setting: Using System DPI System DPI Setting: 96 DPI (100 percent) DWM DPI Scaling: Disabled DxDiag Version: 6.01.7601.17514 32bit Unicode graphics card: geforce 7900 gs

item.title: Graphics Problem
item.dc:creator: mshee32
item.description:
retorrent:

Its a problem with the graphic drivers for nvidia cards, rolling back to older drivers got rid of that problem for me. Anything in the 296.xx range and lower got rid of that and fixed the flashlight issue. Seems like all the Geforce 7 drivers have this problem not sure why could be nvidia messed something up in the newer ones.

thanks every so much :

Read full topic
